title: The Duty of Joy
author: Not provided in the text.
dek: Rejecting simplistic empathy, this article argues for a "Duty of Joy," emphasizing genuine happiness and strength as the most effective way to guide and help others, particularly children.  The author posits that leading by example, radiating joy, and providing a broader context for difficult emotions is superior to mirroring negative feelings.  This "Duty of Joy" scales from personal interactions to a broader spiritual and societal impact.
